bibliographic_metadata.Title: A Framework for Data-Driven Mineral Prospectivity Mapping with Interpretable Machine Learning and Modulated Predictive Modeling
bibliographic_metadata.Author: Nini Mou, Emmanuel John M. Carranza, Gongwen Wang, Xiang Sun

abstract: This study constructs a framework to improve data-driven mineral prospectivity mapping (MPM) in the Qulong–Jiama mineral district of Tibet. It addresses the interpretability of black box models and bias in high-prospectivity areas. The mineral systems concept is applied to select targeting criteria, and model-agnostic methods are used to interpret machine learning models. An ensemble method combines bootstrapping and Random Forest to generate modulated prediction models, identifying exploration targets that occupy just 3% of the study area.
methodology: supervised > tree-based > random forest; supervised > kernel-based > support vector machine

types: Geochemical samples; 7207 samples for 13 elements (Ag, As, Au, Cu, Ba, Bi, Hg, Mo, Pb, Sn, Sb, W, Zn)

key_points: Framework improves interpretability of mineral prospectivity models.
Ensemble method combines bootstrapping with Random Forest.
Final exploration targets occupy only 3% of the study area.
